prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
I apologize for the error message. The plotPCA function requires a DESeqTransform object as input. The error message indicates that we are providing it with a DESeqDataSet instead.

Here is the corrected code:

```
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the gene expression data
counts <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")[,-1]

# Make a DESeqDataSet
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = as.matrix(counts), 
                              colData = read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header=TRUE, sep="\t"), 
                              design = ~ LibrarySelection)

# Run the DESeq analysis
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Apply the variance stabilizing transformation
vsd <- vst(dds)

# PCA
pca_data = DESeq2::plotPCA(vsd, intgroup=c("group", "LibrarySelection"), returnData=TRUE)

# Color by group
ggplot(pca_data, aes(PC1, PC2, color=group)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  theme_minimal() +
  ggtitle("PCA Plot (Colored by Group)")

# Color by LibrarySelection
ggplot(pca_data, aes(PC1, PC2, color=LibrarySelection)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  theme_minimal() +
  ggtitle("PCA Plot (Colored by LibrarySelection)")
```
The vst() function is used to stabilize the variances across the mean values before running the PCA (PlotPCA only works with transformed or rlog-transformed counts). After we apply that, we can perform the plotPCA.
